author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality, presented through the eyes of a child.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society under constant surveillance.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of the mysteriously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for Daisy Buchanan during the Jazz Age.

author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that charts the emotional development of the protagonist, Elizabeth Bennet.

author: J.D. Salinger
description: A novel about the experiences of a young man named Holden Caulfield, reflecting on teenage confusion and rebellion.

author: Herman Melville
description: The narrative of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill the white whale, Moby-Dick.

author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A historical novel that intertwines the lives of several families during the Napoleonic Wars.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel about the journey of Bilbo Baggins, who joins a group of dwarves to recover their treasure from the dragon Smaug.

author: Charlotte BrontÃ«
description: A novel following the emotions and experiences of its eponymous heroine, including her growth to adulthood and love for Mr. Rochester.

author: Joseph Heller
description: A satirical novel set during World War II, highlighting the absurdities of war and bureaucracy.
